contents.title: v1.0
contents.description: Changes and upgrade guide for v1.0.

children.value: If you want help upgrading, you can join the
with a link to your project. I will do my best to answer questions / send PRs to help with the process.
shadcn-docs-nuxt now uses Tailwind v4, which is a major update to the Tailwind CSS framework.
You will need to update your
(follow the migration steps below). Apart from that, this update should be seamless for most users, but there are some breaking changes that you should be aware of:
If you are using tailwind in your custom components, you might need to update your code to use the new utility classes. (See the
for a full list of changes.)
/* If you are using shadcn-docs-nuxt in a monorepo, change the amount of .. to match the node_modules directory */
shadcn-docs-nuxt now supports i18n out of the box, including the following features:
: You can now translate your content using the file structure. You can create a folder for each locale in the
folder, and the content will be automatically translated based on the locale.
: The UI is now fully translatable, including all the components and pages.
: The language switcher is now fully functional and allows you to switch between languages easily.
: The links in the content automatically redirect to the correct locale. You don't have to specify the locale in the links. For example, if you have a link to

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark has-diff

children.value: This is used for the UI language.
Even if you are not using i18n in your app,
If you want to add more UI locales, feel free to contribute to the project.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark has-diff
language-ts shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark has-highlighted
language-ts shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark has-focused

children.value: You can now customize you font in
under the hood, so you can use any font you want.

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}

contents.title: v1.1
contents.description: Changes and upgrade guide for v1.1.

children.value: Click on the image to zoom in and out. This feature is useful for images that need to be viewed in detail.
Color mode images change based on the current color mode (light or dark). This is useful for images that have different colors in light and dark mode.
Click on the dark mode toggle to see the image change.

props.code:
::color-mode-image
---
srcLight: /prose-img/light.png
srcDark: /prose-img/dark.png
alt: Color Mode Image
---
::

children.value: component to embed interactive code examples in your documentation. It supports both StackBlitz and CodeSandbox providers.

props.code:
::playground
---
provider: stackblitz
repo: nuxt/starter
branch: v3
file: app.vue
---
::

children.value: Collapsible code block horizontal scroll bar
Remove language name at the start of breadcrumbs
